Which of the following is/are true regarding JavaScript's prototype inheritance?
(i) It can be used to mimic class inheritance
(ii) If a property of an object does not exist, this property is checked for up the prototype chain
(iii) Every object inherits from exactly one prototype object, including Object (the empty object)
(iv) The keyword null is returned when we reach the top of the prototype chain and the property has not been found
